entry.title: Combined summary - Testnet under attack?
entry.summary: On the testnet chain, new blocks are being created every couple of seconds, as observed on both blockexplorer and btclook. This has raised concerns about whether it is a cause for concern. However, the use of testnet can be limited due to public resource abuse, which can be avoided by creating a local network with -regtest that allows instant block minting, simplifying the testing and app development process. In a 2013 email thread started by Mike Belshe on the Bitcoin-development mailing list, he raised concerns about someone minting new blocks every couple of seconds on the testnet chain. The issue was also observed on both blockexplorer and btclook, and the email included a promotion for DreamFactory, an open-source REST and JSON services provider for HTML5 and Native Apps.
